information:
As of mid-May 2025, the Los Angeles Dodgers hold a record of 29-17, leading the National League West division. The team's offense is ranked as one of the best in baseball, averaging 5.8 runs per game, with Shohei Ohtani leading the team with 16 home runs. Pre-season projections from multiple sources were high; Baseball Prospectus's PECOTA system projected 104 wins for the 2025 season, the most in MLB, while betting markets set their over/under win total at 103.5.

In a recent home series ending May 18, 2025, the Dodgers were swept in three games by the Los Angeles Angels. This was the Dodgers' first three-game sweep at home since June 2023. Prior to this series, the Dodgers had been tied with the Detroit Tigers for the best record in the major leagues. The Angels entered the series in last place in the American League West and were reportedly on pace to post historically poor offensive numbers for the season. Other competitive teams in the National League include the Mets and the Phillies.

Key offensive players for the Dodgers include Shohei Ohtani, who is batting .316 with 16 home runs, and Mookie Betts, who is batting .264. The pitching staff has been managing several injuries. Pitchers Tyler Glasnow and Blake Snell have been recovering from injuries, with Snell having been placed on the 60-day Injured List. The return of Clayton Kershaw is anticipated to bolster the rotation. Pitcher Tony Gonsolin, who holds a 2-0 record with a 2.81 ERA, recently had a start affected by a fingernail issue.

forecast.status_quo_outcome: No - The Dodgers were tied for the best record in MLB with the Detroit Tigers before being swept by the Angels. After losing three games, they likely no longer hold the highest winning percentage and would need to improve relative to other top teams.
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: The Dodgers continue struggling with their pitching injuries and fail to maintain their early season pace. The recent home sweep by the last-place Angels proves to be a sign of vulnerability. Meanwhile, the Detroit Tigers, Philadelphia Phillies, or New York Mets maintain or improve their positions, keeping the Dodgers from regaining the MLB lead over the next 27 days.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: The Dodgers bounce back strongly from the Angels sweep, with their elite offense (5.8 runs/game) continuing to produce and key pitchers like Clayton Kershaw returning from injury. They play well above .600 baseball over the next month while other contending teams experience their own slumps or injuries, allowing the Dodgers to reclaim the best record in baseball.
forecast.rationale: The Dodgers entered the season with the highest projections in baseball (104 wins per PECOTA) and have elite offensive talent led by Shohei Ohtani (.316, 16 HR). Their 29-17 record (.630) demonstrates strong performance. However, the critical factor is that they DON'T currently hold the best record after being swept - they need to improve their position relative to competitors like Detroit. The recent home sweep by the worst offensive team in baseball reveals vulnerability. Their pitching staff faces significant injury concerns with Glasnow recovering and Snell on the 60-day IL, though Kershaw's return could help. With 27 days remaining (approximately 24-27 games), there's meaningful time for teams to separate, but baseball's high variance means outcomes are uncertain. I'm not forecasting higher because: (1) they need to improve from current position rather than maintain status quo, (2) the sweep demonstrates real vulnerability, (3) multiple teams are competitive, and (4) pitching injuries create uncertainty. I'm not forecasting lower because: (1) they remain very close to the top, (2) their underlying talent is elite with the highest preseason projections, (3) their offense is one of baseball's best, and (4) 27 days provides opportunity to regain form. A forecast around 40% reflects they're close but not currently leading, with strong talent offset by recent struggles and injury concerns.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will the LA Dodgers have the highest winning percentage in the MLB on June 15, 2025?

Question background:
Yahoo Sports: [Even as Dodgers navigate injuries and manage pitcher usage, the wins keep coming](https://sports.yahoo.com/mlb/article/even-as-dodgers-navigate-injuries-and-manage-pitcher-usage-the-wins-keep-coming-053322413.html)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the Los Angeles Dodgers have the highest winning percentage in Major League Baseball according to the [MLB official standings](https://www.mlb.com/standings/) when checked by Metaculus on or after June 15, 2025.

No other resolution source will be used to resolve the question. Question resolves based on how the page appears when checked by a Metaculus Admin.


Your research assistant's report says:
As of mid-May 2025, the Los Angeles Dodgers hold a record of 29-17, leading the National League West division. The team's offense is ranked as one of the best in baseball, averaging 5.8 runs per game, with Shohei Ohtani leading the team with 16 home runs. Pre-season projections from multiple sources were high; Baseball Prospectus's PECOTA system projected 104 wins for the 2025 season, the most in MLB, while betting markets set their over/under win total at 103.5.

In a recent home series ending May 18, 2025, the Dodgers were swept in three games by the Los Angeles Angels. This was the Dodgers' first three-game sweep at home since June 2023. Prior to this series, the Dodgers had been tied with the Detroit Tigers for the best record in the major leagues. The Angels entered the series in last place in the American League West and were reportedly on pace to post historically poor offensive numbers for the season. Other competitive teams in the National League include the Mets and the Phillies.

Key offensive players for the Dodgers include Shohei Ohtani, who is batting .316 with 16 home runs, and Mookie Betts, who is batting .264. The pitching staff has been managing several injuries. Pitchers Tyler Glasnow and Blake Snell have been recovering from injuries, with Snell having been placed on the 60-day Injured List. The return of Clayton Kershaw is anticipated to bolster the rotation. Pitcher Tony Gonsolin, who holds a 2-0 record with a 2.81 ERA, recently had a start affected by a fingernail issue.

Today is 2025-05-19.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
